statements.statement: The Great Wall of China is visible from space with the naked eye.
statements.explanation: This is a common myth. The Great Wall is very long but too narrow to be seen from space without aid. Astronauts have confirmed this.

statements.statement: Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found 3,000-year-old honey in Egyptian tombs that was still edible.
statements.explanation: Honey's low moisture content and acidic pH create an inhospitable environment for bacteria, so it can last indefinitely if sealed properly.

statements.statement: Goldfish have a memory span of only three seconds.
statements.explanation: Goldfish can actually remember things for months. Scientists have trained goldfish to navigate mazes and respond to signals over long periods.

statements.statement: The human body contains more bacterial cells than human cells.
statements.explanation: Recent estimates suggest the ratio is roughly 1.3 bacterial cells for every human cell, with most bacteria residing in the gut.

statements.statement: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
statements.explanation: Lightning frequently strikes the same place multiple times. The Empire State Building, for example, is struck about 20-25 times per year.

statements.statement: Octopuses have three hearts.
statements.explanation: Octopuses have two branchial hearts that pump blood to the gills and one systemic heart that pumps blood to the rest of the body.

statements.statement: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain on Earth when measured from base to peak.
statements.explanation: Mauna Kea in Hawaii is taller from base to peak at about 33,500 feet, but most of it is underwater. Everest is the highest above sea level.

statements.statement: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
statements.explanation: Botanically, a berry develops from a single ovary. Bananas qualify, but strawberries are 'accessory fruits' formed from the receptacle.

statements.statement: The Sahara Desert is the largest desert in the world.
statements.explanation: Antarctica is technically the largest desert, as a desert is defined by low precipitation. The Sahara is the largest hot desert.

statements.statement: Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas.
statements.explanation: Humans and bananas share roughly 60% of the same genes. Many fundamental cellular processes are common across all living things.

statements.statement: Thomas Edison invented the light bulb.
statements.explanation: Edison improved upon existing designs and made the light bulb commercially practical, but Humphry Davy and others created earlier versions.

statements.statement: A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
statements.explanation: Yes! A group of flamingos is indeed called a flamboyance, which suits their vibrant pink appearance perfectly.

statements.statement: Water drains in opposite directions in the Northern and Southern Hemispheres due to the Coriolis effect.
statements.explanation: The Coriolis effect is too weak to influence water draining in a sink or toilet. The direction depends on the basin's shape and water movement.

statements.statement: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system, even though Mercury is closer to the Sun.
statements.explanation: Venus's thick atmosphere of carbon dioxide creates an extreme greenhouse effect, making its surface temperature about 900°F (475°C).

statements.statement: Humans use only 10% of their brains.
statements.explanation: Brain scans show that we use virtually every part of the brain, and most of the brain is active most of the time.

statements.statement: Scotland's national animal is the unicorn.
statements.explanation: The unicorn has been a Scottish heraldic symbol since the 12th century. It was chosen because in Celtic mythology, the unicorn symbolized purity and power.

statements.statement: Sound travels faster through water than through air.
statements.explanation: Sound travels about 4.3 times faster in water than in air because water molecules are packed more closely together.

statements.statement: The Amazon River is the longest river in the world.
statements.explanation: The Nile River in Africa is generally considered the longest river at about 4,130 miles. The Amazon is the largest by volume of water.

statements.statement: A jiffy is an actual unit of time, not just a figure of speech.
statements.explanation: In physics, a jiffy is 1/100th of a second. In computing, it refers to the duration of one tick of the system timer.

statements.statement: Napoleon Bonaparte was unusually short for his time.
statements.explanation: Napoleon was about 5'7", which was average or slightly above average for Frenchmen in the early 1800s. The myth arose from confusion between French and English inches.
